metadata.dc:author: Contreras Castello, A
Marco Algarra, J
Morant Ventura, A
Mallea Cañizares, I
Orts Alborch, M
Cano Cuenca, B
metadata.dc:description: Herein we explain the experiences we have had, in the ORL department of the HCU of Valencia, al along a period of seven years, by using the formaldehyde formed fascia graft, exposing the anatomical and functional results obtained after a minimum pursuit of five years on a sequence of 188 myringoplasties. With such method we got to close the tympanic membrane, and that they remain entire after five years, on the 72.87% of the cases, getting improvement of audition determined by a reduction of the air-bone gap greater than 15 dB, in the 62.77% of the cases. Such results are obtained with a very slight number of complications. This all makes us to consider this technique as the proper one in cases where perforation is greater than 50% of tympanic membrane.
metadata.dc:title: Miringoplastias con fascia formolada y moldeada (pie de Perkins) en 188 casos: resultados anatómicos y funcionales a los cinco años.
[Myringoplasty using formaldehyde formed fascia (Perkins' foot) in 188 cases: anatomical and functional results at 5 years].
